p: As with the use of any essential oil, there is care about possible allergic reactions or irritation of the skin with the use of lavender. The topical use of lavender is very common in perfumes, cosmetics, and cleaning products [ 23]. It is well reported that lavender has been frequently responsible for dermatitis [ 24, 25] and reactions to the sensitivity of other members of the Lamiaceae family [ 26]. It can be evidenced by the topical application of LEO in the highest concentrations, where an absence of anti-inflammatory effect was observed.
